abstract: The unique name of the gesture recognizer.
overview:
## Discussion

Assign a string to this property that uniquely identifies the gesture recognizer. Use this name to distinguish one gesture recognizer from another during debugging, or to specify a relationship between gestures in SwiftUI and UIKit.

For example, you can assign a SwiftUI gesture a name when you create it using [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/SwiftUI/View/gesture(_:name:isEnabled:)], as the following code shows:

Then, you can use this [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGestureRecognizer/name] property to refer to the gesture from UIKit. For example, you might do this in your implementation of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIGestureRecognizerDelegate/gestureRecognizer(_:shouldRequireFailureOf:)], as the following code shows:
title: name
